action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I am starting with "table," a common five-letter English word that uses frequently occurring letters.
guess: table

attempts = 1
target_word = staff
guess = table
guess_feedback = t<yellow> a<yellow> b<red> l<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: t<yellow> a<yellow> b<red> l<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "t" and "a" are in the word but not in the correct positions. "b", "l", and "e" are not in the word. I will try "stamp" to reposition "t" and "a" and introduce new letters.
guess: stamp

attempts = 2
target_word = staff
guess = stamp
guess_feedback = s<green> t<green> a<green> m<red> p<red>

guess_feedback: s<green> t<green> a<green> m<red> p<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "s", "t", and "a" are correct and in the right positions. "m" and "p" are not in the word. I will try "stack" to keep "s", "t", and "a" in place and test new letters "c" and "k".
guess: stack

attempts = 3
target_word = staff
guess = stack
guess_feedback = s<green> t<green> a<green> c<red> k<red>

guess_feedback: s<green> t<green> a<green> c<red> k<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "s", "t", and "a" are correct and in the right positions. "c", "k", "m", and "p" are not in the word. I will try "stain" to keep the correct letters and test "i" and "n".
guess: stain

attempts = 4
target_word = staff
guess = stain
guess_feedback = s<green> t<green> a<green> i<red> n<red>

guess_feedback: s<green> t<green> a<green> i<red> n<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "s", "t", and "a" are correct and in the right positions. "i", "n", "c", "k", "m", and "p" are not in the word. I will try "stash" to test "s" and "h" in the last two positions.
guess: stash

attempts = 5
target_word = staff
guess = stash
guess_feedback = s<green> t<green> a<green> s<red> h<red>

guess_feedback: s<green> t<green> a<green> s<red> h<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "s", "t", and "a" are correct and in the right positions. "s", "h", "i", "n", "c", "k", "m", and "p" are not in the word. I will try "staff" to test "f" in the last two positions.
guess: staff

attempts = 6
target_word = staff
guess = staff
guess_feedback = s<green> t<green> a<green> f<green> f<green>

guess_explanation: I am starting with "table," a common five-letter English word that uses frequently occurring letters.
The letters "t" and "a" are in the word but not in the correct positions. "b", "l", and "e" are not in the word. I will try "stamp" to reposition "t" and "a" and introduce new letters.
"s", "t", and "a" are correct and in the right positions. "m" and "p" are not in the word. I will try "stack" to keep "s", "t", and "a" in place and test new letters "c" and "k".
"s", "t", and "a" are correct and in the right positions. "c", "k", "m", and "p" are not in the word. I will try "stain" to keep the correct letters and test "i" and "n".
"s", "t", and "a" are correct and in the right positions. "i", "n", "c", "k", "m", and "p" are not in the word. I will try "stash" to test "s" and "h" in the last two positions.
"s", "t", and "a" are correct and in the right positions. "s", "h", "i", "n", "c", "k", "m", and "p" are not in the word. I will try "staff" to test "f" in the last two positions.
